page.title: 13RIVER CHURN, CIRENCESTER.
page.content: The River Churn is a tributary of the Thames, it flows north to south through our block. The river is about 4 metres wide and 40 cms deep. In our block it is meandering through it's small flood plain. The river is fast flowing and very clear with a stony bottom. There is much private fishing for trout. Due to the unusually wet June weather it is swollen. There are two bridging points at Perrott's Brook and Baunton. Willow trees and elder bushes line the banks which are covered with cow parsley, rose bay, willow herb, nettles and woody nightshade. At the sides grow yellow flag and reeds. Throughout our block the river forms a fairly steep sided valley, all surrounding fields are used for grazing.
